name: Pan Pacific Whistler Village Centre

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Stayed in the Pac Pacific Village hotel as part of a two week "whistle" stop (groan) tour of Western USA/Canada in September 2010 with my wife and 4 other couples.
reviews.title: What a gem of a hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010
reviews.text: This is what a hotel should be like..just pure class in the very classy Whistler. I could not fault this hotel in any way...check in was swift / staff very friendly and attentive / rooms just beautifully luxurious / superb location / breakfast was excellent . I can only imagine the room rate here during the Olympics! Such a well run classy, friendly hotel.
reviews.title: An experience that never stops giving something new and enjoyable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: As for Whistler, well i was blown away and it wasn't even ski season. On the first morning we strolled up to the outdoor market, with live music, just an amazing atmosphere!. The peak to peak ride was brilliant...make sure to get a glass bottom car!. The zip-lining was such an adrenaline rush, with breathtaking views (some of them upside down!)..you cannot visit Whistler and not attempt the zip-lines! Restauarants and bars were superb if a little pricey.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel & Exemplory Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Overall, i couldn't recommend the Pan Pacific highly enough on your trip to Whistler!
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel that met our every expectation - will go again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our trip to Whistler was to experince the skiing and what the Canadian wilderness offers at that time of year. Not to be disappointed, it's everthing your neighbor has been telling you.Yet the most surprising experience was our stay at The Pan Pacific Hotel at Whistler. This was as wonderful as anything surrounding it.The location on the mountain with the views of Whistler and Blackcomb and the convenience to the gondolas could not have been better. The service, to the friendly" hello" and "how was your day" is sincere. The room, well how would you say perfect any other way. The down comforters, the fireplace, the details and yes the constant reminder that this is certainly a place to return to.
reviews.title: WOW

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at village centre for a ski trip in Jan 2010 and have to say wow! Room was unbelievable, huge, loads of storage and really well equipped. Staff were amazingly helpful and cheery at all times no matter what the query. This is the best hotel I have ever stayed at and I will rush back next year.
reviews.title: Amazing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Cannot reccomend highly enough.
reviews.title: Awesome Stay at PPWV

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was one of my favorite hotels EVER, and we have traveled quite a bit. I believe that if people find something wrong with this hotel it is either A) a completely isolated incident or B) They simply can't be happy anywhere. We loved this hotel and Whistler.
reviews.title: Superb & perfect!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: I will start with the hotel.
reviews.title: excellent service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: 1. The staff and management are simply the best I have seen. We have stayed at Fairmont, Westin, etc and NONE can compare. Everyone was so very polite and helpful (this is true for the entire workforce we encountered while in Whister, from hotel, to slopes, to restaurants....The American service industry really could take note!! Especially NYC, but that's another story.). I truly believe the best way to learn the "secrets" of a town is through the locals. Do yourself a favor and get to know your ski instructor, bartender, waiter, hotel font desk manager, etc. They are a wealth of knowledge.
reviews.title: Lovely location and friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: The Pan Pacific Whistler Village Centre is a very nice hotel situated in the heart of the Whistler Village, with easy access to restaurants, grocery store, shops etc. We stayed here for one night in September in a one bedroom suite. Our room included a full kitchen (with oven, stove, dishwasher, granite benchtops) where we were able to prepare a meal for ourselves, and a gorgeous modern bathroom. The room in general was in immaculate condition, and featured a TV in the bedroom as well as the one in the living area. We found all of the staff that we dealt with to be friendly and helpful. A nice continental buffet breakfast is included in the rate and secure underground parking is available, which was also included in our rate. We were very satisfied with our stay here and would definitely stay here if we are ever in Whistler again.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: After they helped us with the luggage and I tipped him very well, they ended up losing our ski equipment. Didn't get on the slopes till late. They eventually found them. They comped my parking, and breakfast the next morning, however, we had to keep calling to find out where our free breakfast voucher was, it went to a different family in the hotel. So disorganized. Then after numerous calls to fix a clogged toilet, they finally fixed it. The heater in the room was very noisy, couldn't sleep with it on. The pool was broken so couldn't use it. And their scrumptious buffet is only a continental breakfast, nothing hot, except the coffee. One nice thing about this property, close to the middle of the village, close to Rics restaurant which is my favorite, and Earl's. No room service either!! It isn't available at all.
reviews.title: What Service?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for two nights in early November. It was very quiet time and we saw only few other customers. Pool was not in use because of the heating problem. There was another pool available in different hotel but it is not the same. Hot tub and sauna were available and hot tub was nice but the sauna was not good and did not heat up enough. We had two room apartment and it was good and spacious. Bed was very comfy and the bathroom had both shower and tub. I would imagine this would be great apartment for two in winter season with all your winter gear. There were two TV’s but the one in the living room was in a cabinet just beside the fire place and the doors did not open well. Only few places in sofa were good enough to watch TV. The rooms are exactly like in hotel photos. There is a good complimentary breakfast with coffee, fruits, bagels, cheese and ham as well as sweet pastry. I would stay here again and will recommend this to anyone looking for modern, well-located 4 star hotel in Whistler.
reviews.title: Cute and good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First, know that there are two Pan Pacific hotels in Whistler. One is right by the lifts ('Mountainside') and this one a few blocks farther away. This location isn't necessarily inconvenient though as Whistler Village is quite compact and pedestrian friendly.
reviews.title: Watch out for extra fees

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The facility itself is nice enough. Rooms are a decent size with the usual amenities expected of a chain hotel of this star rating. Beds are adequate. No flat panel TVs, just old tube TVs and a DVD player is attached. The windows open. Our room had a toasty fireplace and mini kitchenette. HVAC is quite loud. Buffet breakfast is included in some rates but never bothered to check it out as there's other great breakfast spots in the Village. Free wifi (password protected) but coverage is spotty and speeds are slow (can't reliably stream Youtube videos). Luckily, wired connection available.
reviews.title: I would go back in a heartbeat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location
reviews.title: Lovely hotel which lives up to the reviews

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: The Pan Pacific Whistler village centre is well located, right on the edge of the pedestrian zone of the village. This means that shops and restaurants in the lower village are easily accessible, while the upper village is just a few minutes walk away across the day car parks. The Whistler mountain lifts are 5 mins or so walk away. This was fine as we were visiting in September, but probably isn't as desirable if you are staying during ski season.
reviews.title: Did not experienced it, but got a GREAT service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: With respect to parking, we had a hire car with us during our stay, which we parked in the under ground car park of the hotel. This was booked in our rate and worked out at about $10 a day which seemed reasonable, however, it is normally around £25 dollars which is quite expensive. Most locations within Whistler are walkable, and we only used the car to access places outside of the village, such as Brandywine Falls.
reviews.title: A sneaky ending to an otherwise awesome stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: Rooms
reviews.title: Decent, Dog-Friendly Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a studio suite, however, having reviewed the room descriptions on the hotel website, it appears what we actually got was a one bedroom suite. The room was large, with a bathroom, bedroom and separate living/kitchen area. The bathroom had a separate bath and shower, large marble worktop around the sink and good storage space. The aveda toiletries were also very much appreciated! The bedroom was nicely designed with a single wardrobe on each side of the bed and the bed itself was very comfortable.
reviews.title: Awesome hotel in the heart of Whistler Village

aka: Pan Pacific Whistler Village Centre Hotel
description: Pan Pacific Whistler Village Centre is an intimate, family-friendly oasis located in the heart of the Village stroll, yet a 5 minute walk from the Gondolas to both mountains. Complimentary perks include a daily breakfast buffet, wireless Internet, local calls, in-resort shuttle and slope-side valet ski/bike/golf storage. Spacious suites feature full kitchens, bathrooms and balconies and range in size from Studios to Three Bedrooms with Den. Enjoy spectacular mountain views from the sunny deck with salt-water pool and two hot tubs and sauna.
